body: Have you tried other versions of jackson-databind, eg v2.18.2?

The line in question has not been changed for 8 years, but yes, I confirm that it is broken in 2.18.2 too.
https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/blob/287af92705039b2afaa5ce2680026a3f6c25a8e9/src/main/java/com/fasterxml/jackson/databind/deser/BeanDeserializerFactory.java#L508
In case of abstract types, perhaps introspection could try to find factory Creator methods -- constructors should not be used as they cannot really be used directly.

Isn't that what the `@JsonCreator` annotation is for? It is there in the example and does work in basic scenarios (e.g. without polymorphic deserialisation). There are other ways of making a `ValueInstantiator` available too – the code where I am encountering this problem uses bytecode generation and installs a custom `ValueInstantiator`.

I am saying that `@JsonCreator` does work (somewhat) for abstract types (both `abstract class` and `interface`). In other words, introspection does pick it up. The problem is that there seems to be code that assumes it does not happen. Please look at the line of code I cited and the example I provided.

issue.title: Change BeanDeserializerFactory.addBeanProps to check creator properties

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body: To address #4920, changed `BeanDeserializerFactory.addBeanProps` to check creator properties when a `ValueInstantiator` is available.

body: Since I have some time off work, I opened a PR with the proposed fix. Please have a look at #4982.

Ok, good: 2.18/2.19 now work with test passing.

Unfortunately 3.0 (`master`) fails... with

```
[ERROR] Errors: 
[ERROR]   BeanDeserializerFactory4920Test.testDeserializeAbstract:125 » MismatchedInput Cannot construct instance of `tools.jackson.databind.deser.creators.BeanDeserializerFactory4920Test$StringValue` (although at least one Creator exists): no String-argument constructor/factory method to deserialize from String value ('1234567890')
 at [Source: (String)"{ "value": "1234567890", "type": "tools.jackson.databind.deser.creators.BeanDeserializerFactory4920Test$StringValue" }"; line: 1, column: 118]
```
Oh… maybe it’s an issue with the auto-detection of delegating `@JsonCreator`?

@zhenlin I don't know, had no time to look into it last night unfortunately. I'll need to re-open this, might need to move test to `tofix` for `master`.


But auto-detection should not differ in meaningful way b/w 2.18/2.19 and 3.0 at this point.

issue.title: Fix BeanDeserializerFactory4920Test (broken in 3.0)

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body: Fix `BeanDeserializerFactory4920Test` to pass in 3.0. (Was broken per https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/4920#issuecomment-2680404351)
